issue.title: Inline Editor throws an error when open in Dojo
issue.body:
### Bug report

Creating an inline Editor results in an error when opened in Dojo.

Working fine with 2023.2.829

### Reproduction of the problem

1. Open this Dojo - https://dojo.telerik.com/AyeWogaB/2
### Current behavior
An error is thrown on the console

### Expected/desired behavior
No errors should be thrown on the console

### Environment

* **Kendo UI version:** 2023.3.1010
* **Browser:** [all]

issue.title: "Contains" filter and null

labels.name: FP: Unplanned
labels.description: Sync status with associated Feedback Item

issue.body:
### Enhancement 

#### FIltering a string field in the Grid with Contains operators and value null throws an error
Reported in 1492459

#### Current behavior
FIltering a string field in the Grid with Contains operators and value null throws an error
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/46747298/97304599-9fb27100-1864-11eb-8f52-ee3e1cd48eee.png)

https://demos.telerik.com/aspnet-mvc/grid/remote-data-binding

#### Expected/desired behavior
An error shall not be thrown

Environment
Kendo UI version: [all]
Browser: [all]

comment.body: Hi, @gyankov. it might work. The reason is that the real data does contain strings with the value "null", because there are no forbidden words, the user can enter any text. And users enter exactly "null" to see that a value has been entered, but it is empty. Stupid solution, but as it is.....

issue.title: "Contains" filter and null

labels.name: FP: Unplanned
labels.description: Sync status with associated Feedback Item

issue.body:
### Enhancement 

#### FIltering a string field in the Grid with Contains operators and value null throws an error
Reported in 1492459

#### Current behavior
FIltering a string field in the Grid with Contains operators and value null throws an error
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/46747298/97304599-9fb27100-1864-11eb-8f52-ee3e1cd48eee.png)

https://demos.telerik.com/aspnet-mvc/grid/remote-data-binding

#### Expected/desired behavior
An error shall not be thrown

Environment
Kendo UI version: [all]
Browser: [all]

comment.body:
Hi @a-witkowski, this behavior was introduced when we implemented null filtering. Thus, we parse "null" strings to actual null values. Reverting it is not an option, we could, however, add a setting to the datasource, that when set explicitly, will not parse "null" strings to nulls. Would that work for you? 

I am raising the priority of this report, and I will discuss with them any other options that might not require additional configuration.

issue.title: Grid - ToolBar Template Documentation

labels.name: FP: Planned
labels.description: Sync status with associated Feedback Item

issue.body:
### Bug report

The [Kendo UI Grid's Toolbar Template UI for ASP.NET MVC documentation](https://docs.telerik.com/aspnet-mvc/html-helpers/data-management/grid/toolbar#toolbar-template) displays an approach used for [UI for ASP.NET Core](https://docs.telerik.com/aspnet-core/html-helpers/data-management/grid/toolbar#toolbar-template).  The [ClientTemplate and ClientTemplateID](https://docs.telerik.com/aspnet-mvc/api/Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent/GridToolBarCommandFactory#kendomvcuifluentgridtoolbarcommandfactory) are not available for UI for ASP.NET MVC.

### Reproduction of the problem
Please try the approach used in the documentation.  It is not available for UI for ASP.NET MVC.

### Expected/desired behavior
Either include the approach for UI for ASP.NET MVC, or modify the documentation.

### Environment

* **Kendo UI version:** 2022.2.510
* **jQuery version:** 3.6
* **Browser:** all

comment.body: This issue is resolved with the commits related to this issue: https://github.com/telerik/kendo-ui-core/issues/7469

issue.title: Strange behavior when entering end date in DateRangePicker using Enter key
issue.body:
### Bug report
The end date is cleared and the start date is changed in a DateRangePicker when you type the date in the End Date and press Enter key.

### Reproduction of the problem

1. go to this Dojo https://dojo.telerik.com/aYEwOniD
2. type start date i.e. 2023/02/02
3. type end date i.e. 2023/02/04
4. press Enter key

### Current behavior
End date is cleared. Start date is changed to today's date. (in my case 26.10.2023)
![image](https://github.com/telerik/kendo-ui-core/assets/43406491/14c9d728-5a20-4e64-83d5-4e077ddc7794)

### Expected/desired behavior
End date is entered correctly. Calendar popup closes.

### Environment

* **Kendo UI version:** 2023.10.10
* **jQuery version:** 3.4
* **Browser:** [all]

issue.title: Entering date is not possible In DateRangePicker when format is set

labels.name: FP: Unplanned
labels.description: Sync status with associated Feedback Item

issue.body:
### Bug report
The two-digit dates could not be entered/typed correctly in the DateRangePicker. 

### Reproduction of the problem
1. Open the format API example - https://docs.telerik.com/kendo-ui/api/javascript/ui/daterangepicker/configuration/format
2. Try to enter a date after 10th, for example 2023/02/22 

### Current behavior
The number is always changed starting with 0. In the example above the date is changed to '02'

### Expected/desired behavior
It should be possible to enter all dates in the component.

#### The issue is a regression starting with the 2023 R2 (2023.2.606) release and it is due to an issue in kendo-dateinputs-common package

### Environment
* **Kendo UI version:** 2023.2.718
* **Browser:** [all]

issue.title: Days cannot be greater than 9 in "yyyy/MM/dd" format for DateInput

labels.name: FP: Unplanned
labels.description: Sync status with associated Feedback Item

issue.body:
### Bug report
In DateInput, when format is set to "yyyy/MM/dd", the day number cannot be greater than 9.

**Regression introduced with 2023.2.606**

### Reproduction of the problem
1. Open the DateInput demo - https://dojo.telerik.com/edokOJuG
2. Try to enter a number greater than 9 in the day part.
 
### Current behavior
A number greater than 9 cannot be entered in the day part.

### Expected/desired behavior
Numbers greater than 9 should be allowed for the day part.

### Environment
* **Kendo UI version:** 2023.2.718
* **Browser:** [all]

issue.title: Menu items do not collapse properly

labels.name: FP: Unplanned
labels.description: Sync status with associated Feedback Item

issue.body:
### Bug report

When the [hoverDelay](https://docs.telerik.com/kendo-ui/api/javascript/ui/menu/configuration/hoverdelay) of the Menu widget is enabled the items of the Menu do not collapse properly after their initial expand.

This bug is a regression from the behavior in version 2023.1.425.

### Reproduction of the problem
1. Run [this Dojo](https://dojo.telerik.com/@Stoyan/aTAxiDeL)
2. Hover fast over multiple items
   or
1. Run the [TagHelper Demo](https://demos.telerik.com/aspnet-core/menu/tag-helper)
2. Hover fast over the **Using model binding** Menu's items

Behavior occurs only on first expand of the items.
If the behavior isn't reproducible at initially refresh the page and try again.

### Expected behavior
Menu Items that aren't currently hovered over should collapse.

### Current behavior
Menu Items remain expanded.

### Environment

* **Kendo UI version:** 2023.2.606

issue.title: Menu popup container closes on hover when scrollable is enabled

labels.name: FP: In Development
labels.description: Sync status with associated Feedback Item

issue.body:
### Bug report

Menu popup container closes on hover when `scrollable` is enabled. 
This is a regression introduced with v2023.2.606.

### Reproduction of the problem
1. Run this [dojo](https://dojo.telerik.com/@AleksandarEvangelatov/eHeZemIn)
2. Hover a menu item and try to select a subitem
[screencast](https://screenrec.com/share/gyY23R1MSv)

### Current behavior
Popup container closes on hover and subitems cannot be selected.
### Expected/desired behavior
Popup container should not close on hover.

### Environment

* **Kendo UI version:** 2023.2.606
* **Browser:** [all]

comment.body: The issue with the subitem is also reported in ticket **1628549**

issue.title: FileManager's Search placeholder does not update as per the messages
issue.body:
### Bug report

In the FileManager, if you try to override the default Search message through the messages.toolbar.search option, the new message is not being set.

**Regression with R1 2023**

### Reproduction of the problem

1. Open this Dojo example - https://dojo.telerik.com/UTAlEyOK/2

### Current behavior
The Search placeholder message is not being updated.

### Expected/desired behavior

The Search holder message should be updated with the value from the configuration.

### Environment

* **Kendo UI version:** 2023.3.1010 
* **Browser:** [all]

issue.title: Grid with Server Binding does not apply hiding of the columns
issue.body:
### Bug report

When a Grid with Server Binding has hidden columns, all columns are rendered.

**Regression introduced with the 2023.3.1010 version.**

### Reproduction of the problem

1. Implement a Server-Binding Grid.
2. Add Hidden(true) to some of the columns

Represented in ticket #1628397(with a sample project added that replicates the pointed behavior).

### Current behavior

The hidden columns are shown in the Grid

### Expected/desired behavior

The hidden columns should remain hidden.

### Environment

* **Kendo UI version:** 2023.3.1010
* **Browser:** [all]

issue.title: Grid with column menu throws an error when the groupable.enabled is set to false

labels.name: FP: Unplanned
labels.description: Sync status with associated Feedback Item

issue.body:
### Bug report

**Regression introduced with 2023.2.718**

### Reproduction of the problem

1. Run the following [dojo](https://dojo.telerik.com/@alexander64836/oYIHOPer/4).
2. Click on an arbitrary column header's column settings.
3. Notice the error thrown within browser console.


![image](https://github.com/telerik/kendo-ui-core/assets/92315320/2548426c-843a-41cb-91b6-8d8680dd4008)


### Current behavior

Grid with column menu throws an error when the groupable.enabled is set to false and prevents the column menu from opening.

### Expected/desired behavior
Grid with column menu should not throw an error when the groupable.enabled is set to false and should not prevent the column menu from opening.

### Environment

* **Kendo UI version:** 2023.2.718
* **Browser:** [all]

issue.title: Tooltip width incorrectly calculated

labels.name: FP: Unplanned
labels.description: Sync status with associated Feedback Item

issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
Once the Tooltip is shown for a target with short title, if opened for a target with longer title, its width is not updated properly. The shortest width is persisted. Reproducible in all SASS themes, not reproducible in the LESS themes. 

Related Feedback Portal bug report item: https://feedback.telerik.com/kendo-vue-ui/1452077-tooltip-width-incorrectly-calculated

**To reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to [dojo](https://dojo.telerik.com/iBOHaYiJ/2).
2. Hover "Korean"
3. Hover "Korean short"
4. Hover "Korean" again

**Expected behavior**
The Tooltip should resize properly to fit the title of the element it is shown for. 

**Screenshots**


**Affected package (please provide)**
* theme-default
* theme-bootstrap
* theme-material


**Affected suites (please provide)**
* Kendo UI for jQuery (2023.1.425)
* Kendo UI for Vue

**Affected browsers (please provide)**
- Firefox: [latest]
- Chrome: [latest]
- Edge version: [latest]

**Build system information (please provide)**
- OS: [Windows]

**Additional context**
N/A

Browser: [all]

issue.title: Grid Filterable ButtonTitle Message is not correctly applied

labels.name: FP: In Development
labels.description: Sync status with associated Feedback Item

issue.body:
### Bug report

Grid Filterable Button Title Message is not correctly serialized.

### Reproduction of the problem

- Set the [Filterable.Messages.ButtonTitle()](https://docs.telerik.com/aspnet-core/api/kendo.mvc.ui.fluent/filterablemessagesbuilder#buttontitlesystemstring) API Configuration as follows:

    ```
          @(Html.Kendo().Grid<OrderViewModel>()
                .Name("grid")
                .Columns(columns =>
                {
                    columns.Bound(p => p.OrderID).Filterable(false);
                    columns.Bound(p => p.Freight);  
                })
                .Filterable(f => f.Messages(m => m.ButtonTitle("Filter")))
          )
    ```

- Hover the Filter Button Icon and notice that the [buttonTitle](https://docs.telerik.com/kendo-ui/api/javascript/ui/grid/configuration/filterable.messages#filterablemessagesbuttontitle) message is applied instead.

![image](https://github.com/telerik/kendo-ui-core/assets/92315320/c98d7487-43b7-4cee-a91b-7ce9aedc2b48)


### Current behavior

The Filter ButtonTitle message shows its default message.

### Expected/desired behavior
The Filter ButtonTitle should show the custom-provided message.

### Environment

* **Kendo UI version:** 2023.3.1010
* **jQuery version:** x.y
* **Browser:** [all]

issue.title: MVC Grid Toolbar IconClass Ignored

labels.name: FP: Unplanned
labels.description: Sync status with associated Feedback Item

issue.body:
### Bug report

When a UI for ASP.NET MVC Grid contains a PDF or Excel button within the Toolbar, the IconClass is being ignored.

### Reproduction of the problem
```razor
.ToolBar(t => t.Excel().Text("Export to Excel").IconClass("icon here"))
```

### Current behavior
![image](https://github.com/telerik/kendo-ui-core/assets/19593058/5da4fd30-39ba-4789-988c-2278fe9269f5)

### Expected/desired behavior
The specific icon should be added based on the IconClass.

### Environment

* **Kendo UI version:** 2023.2.606
* **jQuery version:** All Supported Versions
* **Browser:** All

issue.title: MVC Grid Toolbar IconClass Ignored

labels.name: FP: Unplanned
labels.description: Sync status with associated Feedback Item

issue.body:
### Bug report

When a UI for ASP.NET MVC Grid contains a PDF or Excel button within the Toolbar, the IconClass is being ignored.

### Reproduction of the problem
```razor
.ToolBar(t => t.Excel().Text("Export to Excel").IconClass("icon here"))
```

### Current behavior
![image](https://github.com/telerik/kendo-ui-core/assets/19593058/5da4fd30-39ba-4789-988c-2278fe9269f5)

### Expected/desired behavior
The specific icon should be added based on the IconClass.

### Environment

* **Kendo UI version:** 2023.2.606
* **jQuery version:** All Supported Versions
* **Browser:** All

comment.body: Fixed with https://github.com/telerik/kendo/pull/18530 Passing the [font icon class name](https://docs.telerik.com/aspnet-core/styles-and-layout/sass-themes/font-icons#list-of-font-icons) to the [IconClass](https://docs.telerik.com/aspnet-mvc/api/kendo.mvc.ui.fluent/gridtoolbarcommandbuilder#iconclasssystemstring) will render the corresponding SVG or Font icon (depending on the application configuration). For example, the following configuration: ``` .ToolBar(toolbar => toolbar.Pdf().IconClass("k-i-gears")) ``` will render a Toolbar Button with an SVG icon ``` ``` Passing an arbitrary class name will render a `span` element with the class: ``` .ToolBar(toolbar =>toolbar.Excel().IconClass("fa-solid fa-user")) ``` ``` ``` Passing a font icon class name or an arbitrary class name to a Command Button results in a similar behavior.

issue.title: Grid PageSizes TagHelper attribute does not expose an IEnumerable overload

labels.name: FP: Completed
labels.description: Sync status with associated Feedback Item

issue.body:
### Bug report

Grid PageSizes TagHelper attribute does not expose an IEnumerable overload


### Current behavior
The Grid PageSizes TagHelper attribute exposes only an `int[]` overload which prevents adding options such as "All".

In comparison to its HtmlHelper counterpart:

```
    .Pageable(paging => paging.PageSizes(new object [] { 5, 10, 20, "All" }))
```

### Expected/desired behavior
It would be a good idea to consider altering the page sizes to accept an IEnumerable overload.

### Environment

* **Kendo UI version:** 2023.3.1010
* **jQuery version:** x.y
* **Browser:** [all]
